Neuroscience.structures.Controller¶

class Neuroscience.structures.Controller.Controller(res, use_old_combinations=False)[source]¶

Bases: Neuroscience.structures.Organ.Organ

A class that controls and manages the configuration of tunable oscillators within a neural network.

The Controller class is responsible for building frequency combinations, managing oscillators, and determining the optimal configuration for neuron activation. It interacts with a set of Tunable_Oscillator instances to simulate complex neural behaviors.

res¶

The resolution of the simulation, affecting time steps.

Type

int

oscillators¶

A list of Tunable_Oscillator instances managed by the Controller.

Type

list of Tunable_Oscillator

brain¶

A list of neurons extracted from the oscillators to form the Controller’s “brain”.

Type

list of Abstract_Neuron

N_REPEAT = 4¶

The number of oscillators to be used in generating frequency combinations.

build_combinations()[source]¶

Reduces the number of elements in the Controller’s main list by removing duplicates and selecting elements that maximize a specific function.

The function f is designed to ensure that for negative movements, inhibitory neurons are used predominantly, and excitatory neurons are used for positive movements.

Returns

A list of optimized frequency combinations.

Return type

list

build_combinations_raw(lower_bound=- 2, upper_bound=2)[source]¶

Builds raw frequency combinations within a specified range.

This method generates all possible combinations of frequencies (with repetition) and applies a set of signs to them. The results are then normalized according to the specified bounds.

Parameters

  • lower_bound (float, optional) – The lower bound for normalization, defaults to -2.

  • upper_bound (float, optional) – The upper bound for normalization, defaults to 2.

Returns

A list of normalized frequency combinations and their associated triples.

Return type

list of tuple(float, tuple)

create_oscillators(ratio)[source]¶

Creates and configures oscillators based on the given frequency ratio.

Parameters

ratio (float) – The target frequency ratio for configuring the oscillators.

Returns

The true value of the ratio and the corresponding frequency combination.

Return type

tuple(float, tuple)

f()[source]¶

Counts the number of elements in the combination that have the same sign as the command.

Parameters

e (tuple) – A tuple containing the ratio and combination.

Returns

The count of elements with the same sign as the command.

Return type

int

find_combination(ratio)[source]¶

Finds the best frequency combination and its corresponding ratio for a given target ratio.

Parameters

ratio (float) – The target frequency ratio.

Returns

The best combination and its ratio.

Return type

tuple(list, float)

find_combination_index(ratio)[source]¶

Finds the index of the closest frequency combination to a given ratio.

Parameters

ratio (float) – The target frequency ratio.

Returns

The index and distance of the closest combination.

Return type

tuple(int, float)

frequencies = [0, 3.003003003003003, 3.6032217041119123, 4.504504504504505, 6.005384137502588, 9.00900900900901]¶

A predefined list of frequencies (in spike/thousand steps of simulation) used to configure the oscillators.

Note: The theoretical minimum interval of convergence is approximately 600 steps.

main_list = []¶

A class-level list that stores the precomputed frequency combinations used by the Controller.

pass_inputs(input)[source]¶

Passes input values to all oscillators managed by the Controller.

Parameters

input (float) – The input value to be applied to the oscillators.
